p: On the other hand, the quantification of the carotenoids’ fraction from the first method, from the sole absorbance value at 470 nm, seems not to be appropriate, since the contribution of the chlorophylls’ derivatives (in this case, mainly pheophytins A and B) to the spectral absorption at this wavelength is significant, as clearly demonstrated in refs. [ 17, 18, 19, 20, 21]. The correlation between the values of total carotenoids obtained by means of the two spectroscopic techniques is worse than for chlorophylls’ derivatives, as reported in Figure 4 (R 2 = 0.9134). Moreover, the method proposed by Mínguez-Mosquera et al. [ 11] gives values underestimated by about 30%–60% with respect to the second method proposed by Domenici et al. [ 17].
